intro: Verschaffeltia melanochaetes, commonly known as the black-stemmed oxalis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive dark, woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native region.
